result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley K Magner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
6 months in the House of Correction/Day Reporting Center. Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, with credit for 8 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Electronic monitoring.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
MUST provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program and any other programs deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley K Magner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction  / Day Reporting Center to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 8 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS
with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Electronic monitoring.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, of drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program and any other programs deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court.
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Bradley K Magner in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bradley K Magner in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bradley K Magner in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/5/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bradley K Magner in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Bradley K Magner in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
